Text: FW STORAGE NOTESWrenshall is continuing liquefaction and should be at full inventory in early February Garners York compressor is down On Monday they will decide how to proceed If they send the unit into the factory then the current inventory of Bcf will be the max for this heating season There may have been some misinformation that the minimum order for vaporization at the LNG tanks is mmcfd In talking to the LNG operators they say that the following are minimum orders for vaporization Wrenshall mmcfd Garner mmcfd This is not the most effiicent operation for their units but it is manageable The utilization of the SBA Peakers at Carlton can be balanced with the use of Wrenshall LNG as a backstop On days when calling SBA Peakers hours in advance is a borderline decision it may be best to wait and use LNG if the situation warrants it In any case the utilization of Wrenshall is encouraged to allow them some run time Utilization of Wrenshall may be possible more often if the volume coming in is mmcfd rather than mmcfd STEVE Original Message From Henley Gaynel Sent Friday January AM To DLETS Gas Controllers Thomas Steve January Steve Subject STORAGE NOTES Storage Notes January Cunningham Maximum Withdrawal mm Maximum Injection mm Redfield Target Maximum Withdrawal mm Minimum Injection mm Lyons mm Monday they would like to increase rate will need Bushton to add horsepower Garner York Rep will be there Monday Can vaporize at rates as low as mm if needed Wrenshall Liquefaction mm Maximum vaporization mm

MAKE NOTE CHANGE IN TIME FOR WEEKLY STORAGE CALLThe weekly storage field call has been moved from Friday at am to EVERY THURSDAY at pm The new phone number is passcode This will start on Thursday Feb th Steve Thomas
